intro: Cordia decipiens, commonly known as the false mallow, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in the summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Cordia decipiens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
